required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of the Blood Sugar Lowering Effect and Safety of Two Insulin Treatments in Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Efficacy and Safety of Step-wise Addition of Short Acting Insulin Analogue Insulin Aspart to Once Daily Insulin Detemir and Oral Anti-diabetic Treatment in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock:
This trial is conducted in Europe, Africa and the United States of America (USA).
The aim of this trial is to compare the safety and efficacy of two different insulin treatments, the "basic" and the "advanced" treatment in type 2 diabetes.

primary_outcome.description: Analysed for the full analysis set.
Measured for the Per Protocol analysis set.

secondary_outcome.description: Number of hypoglycaemic episodes from Week 0 to Week 36, defined as major, minor or symptoms only. Major if unable to treat her/himself. Minor if able to treat her/himself and plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol/L (56 mg/dL). Symptoms only if able to treat her/himself and no plasma glucose measurement or plasma glucose higher than or equal to 3.1 mmol/L.
Alanine aminotransferase was measured in serum at week 36. Serum samples were analysed at a central laboratory.
Haemoglobin was measured in blood samples at week 36. Blood samples were analysed at a central laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cardiovascular Risk Marker: High-sensitivity C-reactive Peptide
secondary_outcome.description: High-sensitivity C-reactive peptide was measured in serum at week 36. Serum samples were analysed at a central laboratory.

arm_group.description: Insulin detemir once daily + oral anti-diabetic drugs (OADs) with addition of meal-time insulin aspart stepwise (1-2-3) at the meals with the largest prandial increments and individually adjusted insulin aspart based mainly on postmeal SMPG (self monitored plasma glucose). The stepwise addition occurred if the treatment target of HbA1c below 7.0% was not reached after 12, 24 and 36 weeks, respectively.

Insulin detemir once daily + oral anti-diabetic drugs (OADs) with addition of meal-time insulin aspart stepwise (1-2-3) at the largest meals and individually adjusted insulin aspart based mainly on pre-meal and bedtime SMPG (self monitored plasma glucose). The stepwise addition occurred if the treatment target of HbA1c below 7.0% was not reached after 12, 24 and 36 weeks, respectively.

intervention.description: Treat-to-target dose titration scheme (individually adjusted dose) for a once daily injection s.c. (under the skin)
Administered 1 - 3 times daily, at largest prandial increment, injection s.c. (under the skin)
Administered 1 - 3 times daily, at largest meals, injection s.c. (under the skin)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 2 diabetes mellitus for more than 6 months
- HbA1c (glycosylated haemoglobin A1c) between 7.5 % and 10.0% at trial initiation (screening)
- BMI (Body Mass Index) less than 40 kg/m2
- Basal insulin treatment for at least 3 months (NPH once or twice daily, insulin glargine or detemir once daily)
- Treatment with one to 3 OADs
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known or suspected allergy to trial products or related products
- Women who are pregnant, are breast-feeding or intend to become pregnant within the next 48 weeks
- Previous participation in any trial including this for the last 6 months
- Use of more than 1 U/kg of basal insulin daily at trial initiation (screening)

results_reference.citation: Meneghini L, Mersebach H, Kumar S, Svendsen AL, Hermansen K. Comparison of 2 intensification regimens with rapid-acting insulin aspart in type 2 diabetes mellitus inadequately controlled by once-daily insulin detemir and oral antidiabetes drugs: the step-wise randomized study. Endocr Pract. 2011 Sep-Oct;17(5):727-36. doi: 10.4158/EP10367.OR.

intervention_browse.mesh_term: Insulin degludec, insulin aspart drug combination

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 67 centres in 12 countries participated: Denmark (1), Finland (6), France (5), Netherlands (6), Norway (5), Russian Federation (4), Serbia (2), South Africa (3), Spain (5), Sweden (3), United Kingdom (7), United States of America (20)
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Eligible subjects were included in a 12-weeks forced titration period with insulin detemir as add-on to current oral anti-diabetic drug (OAD) treatment. Those subjects who did not meet the HbA1c target below 7% were then randomised to one of the two treatment regimens. Any use of sulphonylurea was discontinued at the time of randomisation.

group.title: Advanced
group.description: Insulin detemir once daily + oral anti-diabetic drugs (OADs) with addition of meal-time insulin aspart stepwise (1-2-3) at the meals with the largest prandial increments and individually adjusted insulin aspart based mainly on postmeal SMPG (self monitored plasma glucose). The stepwise addition occurred if the treatment target of HbA1c below 7.0% was not reached after 12, 24 and 36 weeks, respectively.

group.title: Basic
group.description: Insulin detemir once daily + oral anti-diabetic drugs (OADs) with addition of meal-time insulin aspart stepwise (1-2-3) at the largest meals and individually adjusted insulin aspart based mainly on pre-meal and bedtime SMPG (self monitored plasma glucose). The stepwise addition occurred if the treatment target of HbA1c below 7.0% was not reached after 12, 24 and 36 weeks, respectively.

group.title: Advanced
group.description: Insulin detemir once daily + oral anti-diabetic drugs (OADs) with addition of meal-time insulin aspart stepwise (1-2-3) at the meals with the largest prandial increments and individually adjusted insulin aspart based mainly on postmeal SMPG (self monitored plasma glucose). The stepwise addition occurred if the treatment target of HbA1c below 7.0% was not reached after 12, 24 and 36 weeks, respectively.

group.title: Basic
group.description: Insulin detemir once daily + oral anti-diabetic drugs (OADs) with addition of meal-time insulin aspart stepwise (1-2-3) at the largest meals and individually adjusted insulin aspart based mainly on pre-meal and bedtime SMPG (self monitored plasma glucose). The stepwise addition occurred if the treatment target of HbA1c below 7.0% was not reached after 12, 24 and 36 weeks, respectively.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Glycosylated Haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c)
outcome.description: Analysed for the full analysis set.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS) is all randomised subjects exposed to at least one dose of trial products.

group.title: Advanced
group.description: Insulin detemir once daily + oral anti-diabetic drugs (OADs) with addition of meal-time insulin aspart stepwise (1-2-3) at the meals with the largest prandial increments and individually adjusted insulin aspart based mainly on postmeal SMPG (self monitored plasma glucose). group.title: Basic

measure.title: Glycosylated Haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c)
measure.description: Analysed for the full analysis set.
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS) is all randomised subjects exposed to at least one dose of trial products.

analysis.groups_desc: Equivalence analysis with a null hypothesis stating that there is a difference between Advanced and Basic treatment groups of more than 0.4%.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The two treatments are declared equivalent if the 95% Confidence Interval for the estimated difference in means between the two treatment groups is included in the interval from -0.4 to 0.4 for both the full analysis set and the per protocol set
analysis.p_value_desc: P-value for test of difference between treatments.
analysis.method_desc: Regimen, country and previous oral antidiabetic drug (OAD) use as factors and baseline HbA1c as covariate.

outcome.title: Glycosylated Haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c)
outcome.description: Measured for the Per Protocol analysis set.
outcome.population: Per Protocol analysis set: All exposed subjects who completed the trial without significantly violating the inclusion/exclusion criteria or other aspects of the protocol considered to potentially affect the efficacy results.

group.title: Advanced
group.description: Insulin detemir once daily + oral anti-diabetic drugs (OADs) with addition of meal-time insulin aspart stepwise (1-2-3) at the meals with the largest prandial increments and individually adjusted insulin aspart based mainly on postmeal SMPG (self monitored plasma glucose). The stepwise addition occurred if the treatment target of HbA1c below 7.0% was not reached after 12, 24 and 36 weeks, respectively.

group.title: Basic
group.description: Insulin detemir once daily + oral anti-diabetic drugs (OADs) with addition of meal-time insulin aspart stepwise (1-2-3) at the largest meals and individually adjusted insulin aspart based mainly on pre-meal and bedtime SMPG (self monitored plasma glucose). measure.title: Glycosylated Haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c)
measure.description: Measured for the Per Protocol analysis set.
measure.population: Per Protocol analysis set: All exposed subjects who completed the trial without significantly violating the inclusion/exclusion criteria or other aspects of the protocol considered to potentially affect the efficacy results.

analysis.groups_desc: Equivalence analysis with a null hypothesis stating that there is a difference between Advanced and Basic treatment groups of more than 0.4%.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The two treatments are declared equivalent if the 95% Confidence Interval for the estimated difference in means between the two treatment groups is included in the interval from -0.4 to 0.4 for both the Full Analysis Set and the Per Protocol set.
analysis.p_value_desc: P-value for test of difference between treatments.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Novo Nordisk maintains the right to be informed of any investigator plans for publication and to review any scientific paper, presentation, communication or other information concerning the investigation described in this protocol. Any such communication must be submitted in writing to the Novo Nordisk trial manager prior to submission for comments. Comments will be given within four weeks from receipt of the planned communication.
